reviewText: The course seems to play with words. especially, the questions on test should be reviewed to provide better outcomes after the exam.
Not Relevent. Wanted to unenroll the course but dont know why there is no option to unenroll
HORRIBLE
PESSIMO

I am unable to access the readings on the WARC website and have been for over two weeks now. I requested help from your support team over ten days ago and I still cant access the readings. I am stuck halfway through the course and unable to move forward because the answer to the quiz is IN THE READINGS! In the meantime you are billing me monthly for a course that I am unable to move forward with. I will remove this negative review when you give me a FULL REFUND for the last 30 days AND you fix the reading problem. Otherwise I will be cancelling my subscription and requesting a full refund of the entire course.

Not recommended at all: first of all 80% of the reading material is not accessible and the links are broken, and this has been reported in the discussion forums yet nobody seems to read them to fix the glitch. Also, there are some videos in Spanish with no English subtitles available, and some of the videos have a poor sound quality and not easy to follow, especially that the subtitles are not very accurate.
The quizzes were badly done. There was no proper support also from the mentor. very frustrating and annoying
I give one star because there were some new concepts that I learned. Otherwise, the way the course and exams were organized, structured, and delivered, was very bad!
terrible teacher, just speaks and speaks i dindt enjoy because of it the course.
I cannot continue with this course because I am unable to access any of the readings. Until this is corrected, I refuse to continue and will look for something that does not have so many problems.
Hola. Solicité ayuda para que me ayudaran a resolver un problema con la calificación del quiz por una falla en el sistema y nunca respondieron. No pude continuar con el curso.
poorly structed and taught. I need more clear materials
Badly structured and organised, unclear explanations, as well as unclear, misspelled and grammatically incorrect questions in the quizzes, which lead to confusion.
None of the links for the readings are "Secured" therefore, most web browsers will not permit you to open and read them.
Too much to read and very less videos.
Some of the videos are inaudible. The quizzes to not match course content.  Multiple frustrated students in the forums.

I gave 2 stars because of the good reading materials provided in this course.  What threw me off is that the professor seems so stressed out it is easily noticeable. The laughs after each sentence and the constant moving and shaking was no pleasureful.
this thing ruined marketing for me
Very Basic Course. Quiz answers seem to be faulty and options seem to be very ambiguous

This course is hard to rate. The information itself was great, and I learned a lot. It actually felt a lot like a regular college course, which impressed me. However, the course was plagued with technical problems basically every step of the way, so getting that learning done was extremely difficult.

Since the professor is from Spain, the videos are not very clear.  Too much noise from background.  Less of teaching and more of reading material.  one lecture is not even translated.  It was not worth it.
Having the instructor not have english as his first language made for inconsistencies in his communication and it became more confusing what he was trying to say
Content was good. One of the videos in week 1 has terrible audio
Some part of the videos were inaudible  and the transcripts were not well done
There are many typographical and continuity errors in this course. The quality of the videos is also questionable.

Good course, plenty of interesting reading material, exercises
and relevant interviews. Would have been 4 stars if they had translated or
provided the Citroen interview (currently in Spanish only) in English…
Giving 3 stars not for the content but for the quality, sound quality in some videos is very bad and in one video the interview was in a foreign language and subtitles were not there

the videos filmed in the bar did not have a good sound, sometimes the subtitles had some words that where not the same of the audio and in one scheme in the background, some words where not the same that the professor said.
Accent not good enough
Good overview but lacks specific information that would be useful.
I think the model quizes are not hard, but very tricky
Good; need more Live examples
S
Good, lengthy!

Better than the first course in this specialization, but the lack of take-away slides is still a major shortcoming. Often unclear and confusing due to poor grammar. Quizzes unduly hard to get right (some right answers appear wrong by virtue of the way they are worded / relate grammatically to the questions). Sometimes inconsistent materials -e.g. slide in week 4 headed "The positioning statement needs to include" followed by how one should conduct a survey. In short, a really frustrating course: requires interpretational acrobatics to figure out what is being conveyed, to extract key takeaways and to pass quizzes. This make the course unnecessarily 'difficult', when the subject matter itself is not. On the plus side: supporting papers are informative, provide interesting case studies as well as different (and sometimes opposing) perspectives. The latter highlights current debates/controversies in the field and are generally thought provoking.
I would have liked to jave more practical cases

Ok, so the thing is this...The course is awesome! And really i mean it, because it teaches you the basis to start doing things yourself and it motivates you a lot, but:1) There is to bad grammar on the essays and documents they give to us.2) The page from WARC seems to be hacked because everything is a mess.3) In some videos, the audio is awful5) Ignacio needs to practice on his speach, because he seems very nervous on every filming6) Quizes are to tricky. Also, there's to many ambiguous questions that, even for people that works hard to get so much more information from the outside, there is no way we can prove what is wrong or right.But also i want to say thinks to all the staff that made this course possible, i appreciate a lot the effort you are comiting in making knowledge accesible.Kind regards!

Really good level of detail versus other courses and difficult questions which really test your understanding of the subject matter.On the downside, some links were not added to supplementary reading, which is a shame as these resources really help with your understanding
The couse is an excellent one but the audio need to be worked on.
A good introductory course! But we may need more business cases and interactions.
Audio quality is sometime really bad
Am able to gain the main concepts of positioning and marketing strategies; though the quizzes are a bit tricky, the course and teaching are good and clear.
Informational course. I liked the first one in this series a bit more. Also, I feel like the quiz questions were "so so" in their clarity. Just my opinion.
Very informational. Could be a bit more interactive and with peer-reviewed assessment to be more challenging but overall good course.
Can be updated to use more relevant examples, the course is updated only till 2016

The quiz could have better feedback, Say if there are multiple answers right to a question, then tell me which answer I chose are right, because else I'll be confused if what I studied was wrong from the beginning.
Great education with good articles-videos and real life examples.Thank you for making this education much more enjoyable.
Very useful
Interesting accurate course.

Very helpful and informative. Points for improvement would be on general subtitles (and some texts on presentations) as wrong ones could be very misleading and the translation of non-English audio (case in point: interview with Citroen manager who was talking extensively about strategies and insights in foreign, not-translated language).
I love the course content which combined education videos with relevant and interesting industry articles. It gives you a good overview of how to go about positioning.
I found this course on positioning helpful and it also clears my doubts. I learn some key concepts that are new to me. Overall good course to learn about marketing esp positioning.
A really informative course giving a big picture of what devising a market strategy looks like.

Most of the cases here only covers B2C. I didn't see much examples of B2B. I know the the principles in this positioning are the same for B2C and B2B, adding 1 or 2 examples will be great. Anyway I will try it out in my B2B applications.
Very valuable information, which gives you clear idea about trends impact and how to start your marketing strategyExplanation of professor is excellent when it comes to examples, but content wise
good

The first course (Market Research and Consumer Behavior) was a scary one and set a very low bar. This one (Positioning) reassured me and was a good course to go through. Interesting material taken in an interesting manner. Kudos to the instructor too.Points of improvement:Translation/subtitles aren't good enough. I wanted to correct them, but the correction process isn't easy. In one video, a guy speaking in French had no subtitles below.I was expecting more on the practical tools part - for eg: spider web perceptual maps

The fIrst week was non-informative. Besides, the final quiz contained questions on the topics which were covered in the Weeks 2 and 3 only. So I had to guess as the videos and articles did not provide answers to them. The video with Citroen experience disappointed me as it was in Spanish with no English translation (sub-titres were not helpful at all as they just stated "Foreign"). If you target international audience, you must assume that not everybody speaks Spanish. But in general it was very informative course with lots of interesting articles to read. Thank you.

I found the course very clear and interesting. Was very happy to watch video with actual marketing professionals. Littler suggestion: some lectures could be updated with 2016/2017 case studies. Thanks a lot Professor. Halwa

Quite a nice overview of the basics of positioning, defining value to customers and provides a nice high level view. On the negative side: Some of the readings are hard to access on the warc site.

Well designed course, worth its price. There are major problems with subtitles throughout whole course (for example you can spot few times "niche" in subtitles, while the teacher says "needs"), some Spanish parts of videos (interview with guest during Week 4) are not translated at all. Sometimes explanations could be more intuitive. Some quiz questions throughout the course are poorly designed (misleading wording etc.).

I knew little about positioning and its importance; or was using it lightly; but, today I know positioning is very important!

I really enjoyed this course!  As someone from the science field without any marketing background, I especially like Professor Gafo's systematic and organized breakdown of the marketing process.  It serves as a great framework for me to understand positioning.  Thank you Professor for all the tools you provided.  Learning about what positioning is NOT has been equally helpful.  From the reading materials, I appreciated the real life examples of good marketing strategies practiced in different countries.   Thank you again!

Professor Gafo did a great job establishing the importance of positioning and how it is fundamental to the success of a marketing strategy.  I feel much more confident about implementing a positioning assessment or shift for my organization's products and services.
Great course and explanations were in detail. Would highly recommend this course.

I'm learning A LOT! I have a background in marketing strategy, but covering the basics 7 laters in my career I am becoming more up-to-date and remembering things that have been shifted to the back of my head. I recommend this course to beginners as well as people already practicing. Also, I highly recommend taking the entire specialization to get the most out of the new knowledge you will learn as well as a refresher. Who knows, those who are studies and practiced you may learning new things like I have been. Also hearing the things you already know may clarify things you learned a little more as I am experiencing.
